content: Who painted the famous 19th-century painting 'The Starry Night', which depicts the view from the window of his asylum room at Saint-Rémy-de-Provence?

I believe the famous 19th-century painting 'The Starry Night' was painted by Vincent van Gogh. He created this masterpiece while he was staying at the asylum in Saint-Rémy-de-Provence. The painting is known for its swirling skies and the village below, and it's one of van Gogh's most recognized works.
